alert.note: Alert for Lee (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 25 at 10:46AM EST until February 28 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Kentucky... Kentucky River at Heidelberg affecting Lee County. For the Kentucky River...including Whitesburg, Hazard, Jackson, Oneida, Booneville, Heidelberg, Ravenna...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Kentucky River at Heidelberg. * WHEN...From this morning to early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Low lying areas flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EST Friday the stage was 18.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.5 feet Saturday morning. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued at 8 PM on Friday, February 25th.
